intro: Odonellia eriocephala, commonly known as the roughhead mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Odonellia eriocephala is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus.
